description: Some foods help to keep the liver healthy and strong. Here are 5 foods that are good for your liver and help in liver cleansing.
cleaned_text: Why is there a constant emphasis on maintaining a healthy body? Your organs need to be continuously active to perform bodily functions without interruptions. Making nutritious diet choices always proves beneficial, which is also apt for your liver, a vital body organ. What you need to know: [What is the function of the liver?](What-is-the-function-of-the-liver?) [What are some healthy foods good for the liver?](What-are-some-healthy-foods-good-for-the-liver?) [Common liver diseases](Common-liver-diseases) [Habits for healthy liver](Habits-for-healthy-liver) What is the function of the liver? The health of our digestive system depends largely on the liver. Blood from the intestine and stomach passes through your liver. The [function of the liver](https://www.adityabirlacapital.com/healthinsurance/active-together/2022/02/20/how-to-keep-your-liver-healthy-follow-these-5-tips/) is to process the blood to create nutrients. It also metabolizes the drugs to ensure your body can easily use them. Responsible for many body functions, the liver produces bile (a digestive juice necessary for fat absorption into your blood) and glucose, breaks down toxins, and helps to store necessary nutrients. What are some healthy foods good for the liver? Here are 5 best foods good for the liver that can aid in liver cleansing and allow it to function efficiently: Fruits: Apples, Grapes, and Citrus Fruits Fill your fruit basket with apples, grapes, and [citrus fruits like oranges](https://www.adityabirlacapital.com/healthinsurance/active-together/2023/03/02/orange-benefits/) and lemons, which are proven to be liver-friendly fruits. Consume raw grapes and grape juice or supplement your diet with grape seed extracts to increase antioxidant levels in your body and protect your liver from toxins. Having apple slices releases toxins from your digestive tract, easing the functioning of your liver. Including citrus fruits provides your liver with enzymes that help in liver detoxification. Cruciferous Vegetables: Broccoli, Cabbage, Cauliflower Pave the way for increased levels of glutathione, necessary for liver cleansing enzymes, with the consumption of vegetables like broccoli, cauliflower, cabbage and brussels sprout. It also increases glucosinolate production, which helps eliminate toxins from your body. Olive Oil Improve your liver enzyme levels with olive oil and experience other health benefits that tag along with its consumption. The beginning of any liver disease is marked by fat accumulation. Therefore, including olive oil as a part of your diet is a wise choice as it helps to maintain low levels of fat in the liver. Beverages: Coffee and Green Tea Studies reveal that coffee is an excellent choice to detoxify [the liver with its antioxidant properties](https://www.adityabirlacapital.com/healthinsurance/active-together/2018/09/10/4111/). In addition, they also protect you from chronic liver diseases, thanks to their positive influence on liver enzymes. For tea lovers, switching to green tea may be promising as it helps in weight management and keeps you safe from other signs of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). Nuts Opt for healthy snack options like nuts to improve the health of your liver, as they contain antioxidants and unsaturated fatty acids. Nuts are well-equipped to protect your liver against NAFLD. Walnuts and almonds are two of the many options you can choose to snack away. Keep track of the quantity as it contains high calories. An important organ like the liver needs your utmost care to effectively carry out its activities. Therefore, it is advisable to seek medical help when you observe symptoms never experienced before and keep your Health Insurance Plans handy as a precautionary step. The first step to health care is through healthy food. So, begin by incorporating these simple food items into your diet and witness significant and healthy results concerning your liver. Common Liver Diseases Your diet must include certain liver-healthy food to prevent serious liver diseases. Some of the common liver issues are listed below: Hepatitis It is a type of viral infection that leads to a compromised liver. It results in liver damage and inflammation. It is a contagious disease, but you can reduce the risk of contracting it with proper vaccination. Fatty Liver A fat build-up in your liver can lead to cirrhosis and liver failure if not treated timely. Fatty liver symptoms include abdominal pain or a feeling of fullness in the upper right side of the stomach, yellowing of the skin and eyes indicating jaundice, enlarged blood vessels just beneath the skin's surface, enlarged spleen, weight loss, and nausea, among others. Make lifestyle changes and consume healthy liver-cleansing foods to prevent this. Liver Cancer Liver cancer can result from untreated liver conditions or cancer spreading from any other body part. A hepatocellular carcinoma is a common form of liver cancer, which may form a tumor or small cancer spots. Habits For Healthy Liver Eating foods good for the liver can help keep the organ healthy. Some foods good for liver repair are: - Coffee [Tofu](https://www.adityabirlacapital.com/healthinsurance/active-together/2023/03/02/taste-and-texture-or-better-health-heres-the-healthier-protein-between-tofu-and-paneer/) - Oatmeal - Walnuts - Avocado - Milk and Low-Fat Dairy Products - Sunflower Seeds - Olive Oil - Green Tea - Grapefruit - Blueberries - Cranberries - Grapes Other than healthy foods good for the liver, some lifestyle choices can help keep it healthy. These include the following: - Stay physically active - Exercise regularly - Keep your body weight under check - Get proper vaccinations - Protect yourself against diseases like Hepatitis C or B - Keep your cholesterol, hypertension, and blood sugar levels under control - Take specific measures to protect your liver and stay in the best of health Stay tuned to the Activ Living Community.
